revised_title: Observations on the Cicindela Volans: The Flying Glow-Worm and its Luminous Characteristics
tldr: The author, Richard Waller, describes his observations of the Cicindela Volans, or flying glow-worm, in England. He discusses its rarity, behavior, and bioluminescent characteristics, suggesting that the insect may use its light as a lantern to catch prey and navigate at night.
